Posts.Title: Post RP incontinence survey

Posts.Content: New here, brief history, had TURP last year, diagnosed w/ Gleason 6, biopsy 8 months later, Gleason 9. Had robotic prostatectomy, (May 30, 2017) w/ cancer in marginal walls and seminal vesicles. Started Lupron about 2 weeks ago and trying to get financial help w/ Zitiga and will start radiation mid to late August, so I'm all healed up from the surgery. I had bone scan prior to surgery and all clear. Had 34 lymph nodes removed and tested during prostatectomy and all were clear. PSA 4 weeks after surgery was 0.04. My question is, is the Lupron and Zitiga along w/ radiation aggressive enough for longevity? Does anyone know of stem cell treatments and what hospitals do that? My plan is to keep active and enjoy life and I am staying positive and plan to beat this. Thanks,

Had robotic prostatectomy, (May 30, 2017) w/ cancer in marginal walls and seminal vesicles. Started Lupron about 2 weeks ago and trying to get financial help w/ Zitiga and will start radiation mid to late August, so I'm all healed up from the surgery. I had bone scan prior to surgery and all clear. Had 34 lymph nodes removed and tested during prostatectomy and all were clear. PSA 4 weeks after surgery was 0.04. My question is, is the Lupron and Zitiga along w/ radiation aggressive enough for longevity? Does anyone know of stem cell treatments and what hospitals do that? My plan is to keep active and enjoy life and I am staying positive and plan to beat this. Thanks,

I may cheat from time to time, but for the most part, much better than what I used to do. Thanks for all of the support from everyone here. This site has really made me feel much better about my situation. I'm fighting the tiger and not chasing the bunny

Posts.Title: Diet after RALP

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by wtdedula redbelly7; The following study (below) demonstrates the benefits of consuming pomegranate juice to slow the progression of Prostate Cancer. Drinking Pomegranate juice is an easy step to take as it could be substituted for your morning orange juice or coffee and it won't hurt but may help. I prefer to juice whole fruit in a vitamix rather than buying juice in a bottle because I'm sure some of the nutrition is lost in the processing and bottling process. Below is an excerpt from the study ... "The most striking evidence for the biological activity of pomegranate extracts was demonstrated in prostate cancer cells. In vivo and in vitro studies have shown that pomegranate extracts are capable of inhibiting tumor cell proliferation, migration, and invasion, while also inducing apoptosis." If you want to read the full article, the link is below ... https://www.hindawi.com/journals/ecam/2013/701434/ Tim Good read, thanks, I'm taking real pomegranate, broccoli, green tea and turmeric each day. Plus some kale, mixed berries (raspberry, black berry, blueberry) but will probably have to stop some of it at time of radiation, so I get full benefit of the radiation. Good luck on your upcoming surgery!

Posts.Content: Michael F, I did meet w/ Dr Jani one time and was supposed to go back tomorrow, but cancelled, since Albany is so close to me. I was put on waiting list for the on site living, but haven't heard back from them. According to Dr in Albany, he has latest technology and does a CT scan prior to each radiation and the radiation machine overlays the CT scan. According to him, Emory has just gotten this type of machine or getting it. Albany Dr said he was first place in GA to get one. He seems like a good guy and I like him, but like someone said, this is a one time shot and I want it done right. Dr Jani wanted me to be in a trial w/ PET scan and all of that, but I was in a PET scan trial prior to surgery and I'm wondering if they looked at it. If they had seen cancer was in margins or just barely outside margins, shouldn't they have done radiation first? Or treated first in a different way? Dr Rossi from Emory gave me the green light to proceed w/ Dr in Albany and said that he would give just as good treatments as they would. Dang, this is touch decisions.

Posts.Title: just started radiation

Posts.Content: Hey Michael F, doing well here. still a little burn in the urine, but glad to have it behind me. I never stopped going to the flats for trout and reds, but it was nice to go during the week since finishing. My brothers and kids all went down to Southern Woods and had a great time at an all day quail hunt. The day before, we put out 50 for our English Cockers on our farm. Just yesterday, my youngest kids and I were riding around and saw a wild covey. We put the dogs out and they flushed, Robbie was able to get 2 on the rise and my cocker retrieved both of them. Let this life continue on and waiting on the last day of Lupron. Kinda wondering if there will be any sex life after all of this, but I have kind of made my peace w/ it.

Posts.Content: I'm on Zytiga. It's a little bit of a pain to take on empty stomach, but I just wake up in middle of night and take it.
